title: Luigi Mangione, accused of killing a health insurance executive in New York in 2024, leaves Americans divided
subhead: The alleged killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, who was shot dead in broad daylight in Manhattan a year ago, appeared in court for a preliminary hearing on Monday, December 1. He faces life in prison.
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: Raphaël Varane: 'Showing vulnerability does not mean you're weak'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the retired footballer shares his experiences with mental health issues during his career and calls on his sport to break the silence around these problems, which affect an estimated 20% to 35% of professional players.

title: Marseille grapples with drug trafficking: 'They are so many and they have so much money'
subhead: After the murder of Mehdi Kessaci, the brother of an activist against drug trafficking, Le Monde spoke with residents of housing projects, social workers, judges and police officers. They described a growing sense of powerlessness and danger.

title: When private anger turns into a social force
subhead: In France, anger is everywhere: in the public sphere, in the media and at the ballot box. The majority of French people under the age of 35 say they have experienced it. From private feelings to collective outcries, they search for ways to channel this emotion.

title: Gay Talese, the last titan of the American press
subhead: He was a pioneer of New Journalism, a movement that transformed American journalism with a literary writing style. At 93, the author of the landmark 1966 profile 'Frank Sinatra Has a Cold,' finds his daily life increasingly constrained by old age.
